result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence P Wolfe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 13 days jail credit only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol.

Take all medications as prescribed by treating physician or medical provider and in the manner in which they are prescribed.

Defendant must cooperate in transferring the vehicle in case 14CV51 to Forest County Sheriff's Department prior to 9/12/14 pursuant to the agreement of parties.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Huber allowed.
Eligible for Community Service under 973.03(3).
No objections to serving the sentence in any other county jail in Sate of Wisconsin but is the ultimate decision of the sheriff.
Report on or before 9/12/14 at 8:30 to Forest County Jail unless arrangement have been made to serve in another county.

supervisions.notes:
Unpaid costs to be taken from 25% of his prison accounts.
Consecutive to: Any sentence currently serving

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: of Personal Re-Morse

Defendant Lawrence P Wolfe in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Lawrence P Wolfe in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:04 PM. Voorhees has revocation paperwork, states it is substantially accurate but states that the defendant raises some minor statements in it but otherwise it is accurate. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - has received a copy of a letter from the defendant and has reviewed it as has the Court - recommends 8 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 5 years of initial confinement - consecutive to any sentence that he is currently serving, followed by 3 years of ES. Voorhees makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends a modest concurrent sentence. Wolfe makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement - consecutive to any sentence he is currently serving, followed by 3 years of ES - credit as set forth on revocation summary (167 days credit), eligible for programs, any remaining costs are to be taken fro 25% of his prison accounts, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 30, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Lawrence P Wolfe
Current: P. O. Box 214, Watertown, WI 53094 United States  (Effective: 08-27-2014)
Prior: 115 North Washington Street, Watertown, WI 53094

Called at 3:08 PM. Also called 14CV51. Lawrence Wolfe appears in person and with counsel Karen Lueschow. State appears by Charles Simono. State - resolved - defendant would plead G to count #1 as alleged, DRI remaining counts, joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 60 days conditional jail, $750.00 fine plus costs and surcharges, forfeit vehicle under 14CV51 - will work with the parties on that condition, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, employment/school, 200 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed by treating physician or medical provider, ask for delay in reporting for stated reasons and have no objections to that. Lueschow agrees as does Wolfe - only issue is that the defendant be allowed to play pool in a bar setting so that condition would be affected - has 12-14 days credit, defendant would be relocating to Dodge County and needs time to get that straightened out. State agrees. Wolfe pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #3 and #4. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Lueschow - follow joint recommendation - asks for huber on jail time. Wolfe makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 60 days conditional jail - huber allowed - no objections to serving the sentence in any other county jail in State of WI but is the ultimate decision of the sheriff - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - report on or before 9/12/14 at 8:30 AM - report to FC Jail unless arrangements have been made to serve in another county, $750.00 fine plus costs and surcharges (DNA) - take bond posted - remainder due thru probation, cooperate in transferring the vehicle in case #14CV51 to FOSO prior to 9/12/14 pursuant to agreement of parties, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 200 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed by treating physician or medical provider and in the manner in which they are prescribed, 13 days credit only if revoked (stipulated), submit DNA sample with surcharge assessed - paid thru probation, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
State's
defense
Final pre-trial on August 27, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Called at 10:23 AM. Lawrence Wolfe appears in person and with both counsel Thomas Roley and Karen Lueschow. State appears by Jodi Bednar Clemens. Lueschow has now been appointed by SPD and Roley's motion to withdraw as counsel is granted. Lueschow informs court that discovery has not yet been received or an offer. Court is aware of that due to off-record conversations, set matter for another FPT. Court continues bond, set for FPT on 8/27/14 at 2:30 PM.
to Withdraw and Notice of Hearing

Called at 10:59 AM. Lawrence Wolfe appears in person and with counsel Thomas Roley. State appears by Charles Simono. State - believe waiver of H and has filed Information that mirrors complaint in anticipation of the waiver. Roley and Wolfe have Information. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Roley waives furtgher reading of Information and will proceed to ARGN, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, set for FPT on 7/30/14 at 10:00 AM. Roley - bond - asks for reduction in bond for stated reasons. State - bond - ask for at least a $500 cash bond for stated reasons. Court reduces bond to $500 cash with same conditions.
and Certificate of Appearance - CLR

Called at 1:41 PM. Lawrence Wolfe appears via video from FOSO and with counsel Thomas Roley appearing specially for Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. Wolfe has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Wolfe understands charges. Roley has complaint and waives further reading of it and gives available dates for Ms. Burns for a PH - can do PH if time limits are not waived. State - bond - remain in effect as is. Roley - no comment. Court continues bond, set for PH on 6/25/14 at 3:00 PM.
No consumption of alcohol.
Cash set.
